data.title: Movies directed by Jan Troell
data.meta_description: On Reelviews you can find extended reviews and ratings for movies directed by Jan Troell, including thoughts on the world of cinematography by James Berardinelli.
data.text:
Everlasting Moments

A moment frozen in time through the lens of a camera - that's one of many images director Jan Troell uses to cement the foundation of his new period piece, Everlasting Moments. The chronicle of a woman who lived and died in the early part of the 2...

Hamsun

Nobel prize winning writer. Nazi sympathizer. Deep thinker. Naive fool. To some, Knut Hamsun was a hero, but to most, he was a villain and a coward who sold out to Hitler for the price of safety and respect. In Hamsun, a powerful 1996 feature ...
